subject: Investing
title: The Bond Ladder Strategy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Bond Ladder Strategy.

hook.text: Buy bonds maturing in 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 years. Each year one matures. Reinvest it at the long end. Repeat forever.

buildup.text: A bond ladder spreads maturities evenly. It provides regular cash flow and reduces the risk of bad timing.

discovery.text: If rates rise, your maturing bonds reinvest at higher yields. If rates fall, your existing bonds still pay well.

twist.text: Laddering sacrifices some yield. You won't fully benefit from locking in high rates if rates are about to fall.

climax.text: Retirees love ladders for predictable income. Each rung provides a known payout at a known date.

punchline.text: A bond ladder hedges against the one thing nobody can predict: future rates.

quiz.question: What is the main benefit of a bond ladder strategy?
options: It reduces the risk of reinvesting all at once at bad rates
It guarantees the highest possible yield
